The '''Egladil''', or the '''Angle''' in [[Westron]], was the name given by the [[Galadhrim|people of Lórien]] to their lands between the courses of the rivers [[Anduin]] and [[Celebrant]].<ref name="Lorien">{{FR|Lorien}}, p. 247</ref> A part of the [[Naith]], Egladil was the most populated part of the country, where the tree-city of [[Caras Galadhon]] was to be found.<ref>{{FR|Lorien}}, p. 350</ref><ref>{{FR|Mirror}}, p. 353</ref>

On 16 February {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, February 16, p. 1092</ref> a parting feast was held there when the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] departed [[Lothlórien]]<ref>{{FR|Farewell}}, p. 373</ref>.

==Etymology==
''Egladil'' is a [[Sindarin]] name, which means "Elven-point"<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Egladil'', p. 307</ref> or "Angle"<ref name="Lorien"/>. Paul Strack suggests that it is a combination of the prefixal form ''Egla-'' of ''[[Eglath|Eglan]]'' ("Forsaken (Elf)") and the lenited form of ''[[til]]'' ("point", "spike", "(sharp) horn", "ending").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-2072546501.html|articlename=S. ''Egladil'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=04 December 2024}}</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In earlier drafts to ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', the location was named '''''Nelennas''''' and '''''Nelen''''', sometimes glossed as "Gore", which was part of the larger '''''Narthas'''''.<ref>{{TI|Lothlorien}}, p. 236</ref>

Other candidate, and more specific, names were '''''Calennel''''' and '''''Calendil''''', which is translated as "Green-tine" or "Green-spit".<ref>{{TI|Farewell}}, outline ''(b)'', p. 268</ref>

[[Christopher Tolkien]] notes a confusing fluidity in how his father alternated the names and their meanings, regarding the larger "Angle" region between the rivers, and the specific "[[Tongue]]" at their confluence.<ref>{{TI|Farewell}}, note 5, pp. 287-8</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2008: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The name "Egladil" is specifically applied to the eastern area of Lothlorien, directly bordering by the Anduin.
